A Psalm<S>4210</S> of David<S>1732</S>. The LORD<S>3068</S> said<S>5002</S> unto my Lord<S>113</S>, Sit<S>3427</S> thou at my right hand<S>3225</S>, until I make<S>7896</S> thine enemies<S>341</S> thy footstool<S>1916</S> <S>7272</S>.
The LORD<S>3068</S> shall send<S>7971</S> the rod<S>4294</S> of thy strength<S>5797</S> out of Zion<S>6726</S>: rule<S>7287</S> thou in the midst<S>7130</S> of thine enemies<S>341</S>.
Thy people<S>5971</S> shall be willing<S>5071</S> in the day<S>3117</S> of thy power<S>2428</S>, in the beauties<S>1926</S> of holiness<S>6944</S> from the womb<S>7358</S> of the morning<S>4891</S>: thou hast the dew<S>2919</S> of thy youth<S>3208</S>. <sup>from: or, more than the womb of the morning: thou shalt have, etc</sup>
The LORD<S>3068</S> hath sworn<S>7650</S>, and will not repent<S>5162</S>, Thou art a priest<S>3548</S> for ever<S>5769</S> after the order<S>1700</S> of Melchizedek<S>4442</S>.
The Lord<S>136</S> at thy right hand<S>3225</S> shall strike<S>4272</S> through kings<S>4428</S> in the day<S>3117</S> of his wrath<S>639</S>.
He shall judge<S>1777</S> among the heathen<S>1471</S>, he shall fill<S>4390</S> the places with the dead bodies<S>1472</S>; he shall wound<S>4272</S> the heads<S>7218</S> over many<S>7227</S> countries<S>776</S>. <sup>many: or, great</sup>
He shall drink<S>8354</S> of the brook<S>5158</S> in the way<S>1870</S>: therefore shall he lift up<S>7311</S> the head<S>7218</S>.
